column5: hey guys ive probably posted this many times in the past but ym dad keeps nagging me to do it again. so me, m brother and my dad are looking for a drive to lodge for the first week of august. the drive can be up to 7 hours max from toronto. looking to fish for walleye, pike and bass. decent prices, nice cabins, nice boatsm good food. anyone have any suggestions? it will help a lot.  thanks!
This fills all your criteria to a T, plus the setting is spectacular:  http://www.brennanharbour.com/resort.htm

Can you define decent prices. With meal plans the price will jump quickly. $2000 - $2400 dollars for a week for 3 with meal a plan may be a decent price to some but not to others. House keeping (cook your own meals) will keep costs down & open up many more options. Finding a place (first week of Aug) may also be somewhat limited due to a lot of the better places may already be booked.
www.sandbeachlodge.com  I believe we have everything you are looking for.  Only a 3-3.5 hr drive on mostly 4 lanes and very quiet river as majority of the shoreline is provincial park.
Check out the four lodges on Lady Evelyn Lake - Island 10,Garden Island and  Red Pineall have American Plans; and Ellen Island Camp has housekeeping.
I'll second this- we are booked for Brennan Harbour this year and in my research found only positives With a few extras our estimate for price all in is $1200 per guy,
check out Lakair Lodge (www.lakair.com) I love that place..!
I know Capt. You've been there so much it's almost like home to you eh? Glad you love the place.
